alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Knox; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 5:36AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following counties, Daviess, Knox and Sullivan. * WHEN...Until 845 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 535 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rain will fall this morning, and flooding may become worse. Be sure to monitor for possible warnings this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vincennes, Washington, Bicknell, Odon, Elnora, Oaktown, Monroe City, Wheatland, Bruceville, Plainville, Sandborn, Montgomery, Edwardsport, Decker, Cannelburg, Alfordsville, Freelandville, Vincennes University, Glendale Fishery and West Boggs Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
